description: Document Describing Information About the Donors; Donor ID
name: Donor

properties.NEWdomains: enum(Add, Modify, Hold, Cancel, Suppress, Release, Protect, Validate)
properties.domain: enum(Add, Modify, Hold, Cancel, Suppress, Release, Protect, Validate)
properties.description: Status of the document
properties.name: Status
properties.comments: Assigned by server at different stages.

properties.description: Version of this data model schema
properties.name: Schema Version

properties.description: Gender of sample donor (Example: Male, Female, Gender unknown). This field is a look-ahead search box that connects to BioPortal and provides the correct ontology term for gender.
properties.name: Sex

properties.description: The ethnicity of the donor
properties.name: Ethnic Group

properties.description: The racial category of the donor
properties.name: Racial Category

properties.description: Sample type (experimental sample or control sample)
properties.name: Donor Type

properties.description: Category -- Health Status
properties.name: Health Status

properties.description: Current health status of the donor at the time of collection
properties.name: Current Health Status

properties.description: Prior malignancies, heart diseases, any other related disease conditions
properties.name: Medical History

properties.description: Smoking history, if available
properties.name: Smoking History

properties.description: Medications used, if available
properties.name: Medications

properties.description: Treatment history of patient
properties.name: Treatment History

properties.description: Family history - Details of family members with related health/disease conditions
properties.name: Family History

properties.description: The age of the donor at the time of entry into this database.
properties.name: Age

properties.description: Life stage of the sample donor (Example: fetus, neonate, adult, embryo stage, postnatal). This field is a look-ahead search box that connects to BioPortal and retrieves a list with correct ontology terms for various developmental stages.
properties.name: Developmental Stage
properties.comments: enum(Fetal, Newborn, Child, Adult, Embryonic, Postnatal, Other, Unknown)

properties.description: Is the patient alive or dead?
properties.name: Has Expired?

properties.description: If the patient donor has expired, provide estimated date of death
properties.name: Estimated Date

properties.description: Time elapsed since the donor's death
properties.name: Post-mortem Interval

properties.description: Additional notes about donor
properties.name: Notes

items.description: ID of Sample document of biological parents or sibling donor that has at lease one parent in common or identical twin donor who shares same genetic material, if known
items.name: Family Member

properties.description: Relation type (Example: Mother, Father, Brother, Sister, Identical twin). This field is a look-ahead search box that connects to BioPortal and retrieves a list of correct ontology terms for all possible relation types.
properties.name: Relationship
properties.comments: enum(Mother, Father, Brother, Sister, Identical Twin, Other)

properties.description: Relative ID (accession) of doc - provide Document URL
properties.name: DocURL

properties.description: Items -- Family Members - Related Documents â€“ List of Related Samples
properties.name: Family Members

items.description: Alias Accession ID of this Biosample in other databases (Example: SRA, GEO)
items.name: Accession

properties.description: Database name of alias (SRA, GEO, DDBJ, ENCODE, dbGaP)
properties.name: dbName

properties.description: URL that points to this Biosample in alias database
properties.name: URL

properties.description: Items -- Aliases
properties.name: Aliases

properties.description: Value of this additonal metadata property
properties.name: Value

properties.description: Additional notes about this metadata property and value
properties.name: Notes

properties.description: Custom metadata fiels defined by users
properties.name: Custom Metadata
